intro: Psychotria hombroniana, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Psychotria hombroniana is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and its ecological importance in its native habitat.
